title: Educational Hypermedia Design and Evaluation Methods for Distance Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and foundational concepts of instructional design
context.additional_context: Non-real-time online course for pre-service/in-service teachers to strengthen hypermedia design competencies in language education, operating with formative assessment and providing digitally supported environments

learning_goals: Learners can apply the six evaluation domains (general impression, technical quality, usability, scenario, multimedia documentation, and educational aspects) when designing educational hypermedia
Learners can maximize learning effectiveness by designing and integrating multimedia materials (photos, typography, videos, etc.) suitable for remote education environments
Learners can conduct formative evaluations of educational hypermedia prototypes using assessment tools based on the CEPIAH methodology
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
